body: Abraham, I forgot to mention here that you bug you reported was fixed a few days ago: [https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/ladybug/issues/229](https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/ladybug/issues/229) Amadeo, Thank you for posting your knowledge.  I am still a bit unclear on how the waldram diagram divides up the sky of if it is different from a Tregenza division of the sky.  However, I can tell you that running the new Ladybug view analysis component with a high skyResolution is likely to give you a more trustworthy result than an ecotect study with a low sky resolution.  For a sanity check about how the calculation is being run in Ladybug, you can always connect up a vector display to the new 'viewVec' output of the component: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/y*uTehDOGQsFIkqcHfnpUOphJxFLbz4OpH25O77KEoVtqYXy*mE4JHt3DwtDtpLSPl2Rp2iz4*T6QjAfg-K75rU3*rgzMojV/ViewVectorDisplay.JPG) By changing the slider, you can understand how the accuracy of the simulation improves with higher resolutions. Hope this helps, -Chris
